resources.string: Credentials will be stored and backed up via Block Store by Google. This means credentials will persist between app installs. There is an option to manually enter credentials each time on the Journey page if you do not wish to save credentials this way.
Failed to store credentials. Use manual credential entry.
Device does not support e2e encryption, therefore credentials can\'t be saved. Adding a device passcode if none is present could fix this.
Credential will not be stored once the app leaves memory.
Credential set up successfully, without saving to credential storage.
The camera is required to capture documents. If the permission has been declined you will need to manually go to the app settings to enable it.
Preview photo of captured face image

Unfortunately, android apps can only copy small sizes to the clipboard at once, so the operation has to be split into parts. This will not impact end users as they would not need to copy/paste this data.
Failed to copy base64 string to clipboard
